content.description:
Who knew there were crimps under the moss?

Depending on the last time someone climbed, the holds might be covered in moss so bring some cleaning rags and refer to beta photo.

Start on bottom jugs to a right sloper and left pinch. Then crimps until the top. Watch out for wildlife as you slither up to topout.

(Wildlife includes HARMLESS slugs, snails, millipedes, spiders)
content.protection:
Crash pad definitely needed, spotter recommended.

If you are going to hangout for more than 10 minutes bring something to scare away mosquitoes (sage, spay, etc.)
content.location: Base of trail 4, in front of the big, mossy rock.

content.description: Scrubbed this off a couple years ago, noticed it had some chalk on it the other day and though I'd put it up on MP. Starts on a huge jug furtherest left in the overhang and traverses right on frictionless slopers and crimps with poor feet, topout on the highest point to the right. Felt harder than v5 at first, but found some wacky hand-heel matching beta... Very tricky!
content.protection: doable without a pad, as it is mostly traversing only a few feet off the ground, but you'll most likely knock the wind out of yourself falling off the crux. I remember an exciting bike ride across town and up the hill with a huge crash pad on my back when I first did it!
content.location: base of trail 4, in front of the big, mossy rock(not worth climbing, slab carpet, TRed it once). Only thing not covered in moss, it is pretty easy to find.

content.description: Sit start from jug match. Problem stays left and finishes with top out. Crux is halfway up. Permitted holds are marked on topo.
content.protection: Pad... or a really thick jacket and a helmet.
